events.event: Life of Buddha, Confucius, Lao Tsu (beginnings of Confucianism, Buddhism, Daoism)
Greek Golden Age - democratic Athens, philosophers (Socrates, Plato, Aristotle)
Justinian begins rule of Byzantine Empire
Rise of Islam and the Islamic Empire
Battle of Manzikert (Seljuk Turks defeat Byzantine Empire)

1.title: Period 1: c. 1200 C.E. to c. 1450 C.E.
1.subtitle: Unit 1: The Global Tapestry | Unit 2: Networks of Exchange

events.event: Muslims conquer northern India and establish Delhi Sultanate
Magna Carta signed by King John of England
Mongols conquer Baghdad (end of Abbasid Caliphate)
Last major European Crusade to the Holy Land
Marco Polo travels through the Mongol Empire
Mongols conquer Song China (establish Yuan Dynasty)
Beginning of Renaissance in Florence, Italy
Travels of Ibn Battuta through Dar al-Islam
Zheng He (Ming China) begins voyages around Indian Ocean
Prince Henry of Portugal founds a navigation school

2.title: Period 2: c. 1450 C.E. to c. 1750 C.E.
2.subtitle: Unit 3: Land-Based Empires | Unit 4: Transoceanic Interconnections

events.event: Columbus's voyage; end of the Spanish Reconquista and expulsion of Spanish Jews
King Afonso of Kongo writes to King of Portugal asking to slow the slave trade
Martin Luther begins the Protestant Reformation
Spanish conquest of the Inca Empire (starts)
Ottomans defeated by Europeans at the Battle of Lepanto (Mediterranean Sea)
Height of the Ottoman, Safavid, and Mughal Empires
Ana Nzinga's war against the Portuguese begins
King Louis XIV builds Palace at Versailles
Manchu conquer China and establish the Qing Dynasty
Metacom (King Philip)'s War against New Englanders begins
Isaac Newton publishes his work on gravity and the laws of motion
England establishes a constitutional monarchy with a Bill of Rights
John Locke publishes his Two Treatises on Government (beginning of Enlightenment)
Peter the Great begins "westernization" of Russia

3.title: Period 3: c. 1750 C.E. to c. 1900 C.E.
3.subtitle: Unit 5: Revolutions | Unit 6: Consequences of Industrialization

events.event: American Revolution/Adam Smith writes Wealth of Nations
European revolutions/Marx & Engels write Communist Manifesto
Berlin Conference - European powers' division of Africa
Spanish-American War - US acquires Philippines, Cuba, Guam, & Puerto Rico
Boer War - British in control of South Africa

4.title: Period 4: c. 1900 C.E. to the present
4.subtitle: Unit 7: Global Conflict | Unit 8: Cold War and Decolonization | Unit 9: Globalization

events.event: Stock market crash/start of the Great Depression
German invasion of Poland/start of WWII
Pearl Harbor, entry of US into WWII
End of WWII/1st atomic bomb dropped on Hiroshima/founding of the United Nations
Independence & partition of India/start of the Cold War
Independence of Ghana (first sub-Saharan colony to gain independence)
Fall of USSR/end of the Cold War/The Gulf war
Genocide in Rwanda/end of Apartheid in South Africa
Founding of the World Trade Organization
